Description:
JOB TITLE: Manager, Mechatronics Engineer

Location: Richmond, CA

Business Unit: Zygo

Posting Date:

Job Description:

Come join a company where what you do makes a difference. For over 50 years, Zygo Corporation, located in Middlefield, CT has been a global leader in the design and manufacture of advanced optical metrology systems and ultra-precise optical components and assemblies. We are a worldwide supplier of optical metrology instruments, high precision optical components, and complex electro-optical system design and manufacturing services. Recognized as a valued partner by its customers for innovative technology, application expertise, product reliability, and responsiveness, ZYGO has been driven by a passion for innovation, as evidenced by approximately 750 patents awarded since its foundation.

We are dedicated to helping you grow your career by using all your talents, insights and experiences in a welcoming team environment. Bring your passion, commitment and curiosity and come grow with us as together we work to make our world a better place.

What You'll Do

 Responsible for people management and career development activities including recruiting, onboarding, training, mentoring, coaching, and performance evaluations.  Responsible for leading a group of mechatronic engineers to perform conceptual design, analysis, and development of new products and innovative changes to existing products.  Support capital equipment procurement, from concept to commissioning for optical fabrication and metrology tools.  Work with multiple engineering disciplines and co-developers to ensure timely realization of competitive, serviceable products that keep the semiconductor industry moving forward.  Responsible for resource allocation and working with Team Leads to anticipate program staffing and skillset needs.  Lead continuous improvement projects to further improve the quality and efficiency of the organization. 

What You Need To Know

 Engineering/Physics degree required, or equivalent experience. Mechanical/Mechatronic Engineering degree preferred.  Minimum 4 years in a people leadership role.  Experience leading a multi-disciplinary technical program preferred. Experience in EUV semi-conductor industry is a plus.  Skills working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that.  You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues.  You will be open to other’s perspectives to help drive solutions.  Ability to coach and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.  Must be able to manage change, take initiative and handle ambiguity.  Must be able to read and interpret data, information, drawings, and documents.  Strong customer focus and commitment to customer satisfaction through prioritization, quality, efficiency, and professionalism.  Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads and deadlines.  Results driven, demonstrate ownership and accountability.  Demonstrate open, clear, concise, and professional communication.  Capability to interface with multidisciplinary groups (including senior leadership), and be willing to take on responsibility, follow through and keep multiple simultaneous projects on schedule.  Ability to inspire and coach individuals and groups to achieve career development and performance targets. 

What You Want To Know

Competitive benefits

401(k)

Due to the nature of Zygo’s programs, products and customers, all applicants must have the legal right to work in the United States of America and must be legally authorized to access export-controlled information and source code.

Compensation

Salary Minimum: $180,000

Salary Maximum: $190,000

Incentive: No

Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.
